samples.context: Biodegradable plastics are designed to break down more quickly than traditional plastics. They are made from renewable sources such as corn starch or sugarcane and can decompose naturally when exposed to the right conditions. However, some biodegradable plastics still require specific environments, like industrial composting, to fully decompose without releasing harmful substances.
